Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Imcroporin (natural AMPs; scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: The synthetic form of the peptide is C-terminally amidated (Personal communication). Likely to form a helical structure based on helical wheel projection. The peptide showed good activity against G+ bacteria such as M. Luteus AB93113, B. thuringiensis AB93066, S. aureus AB94004, B. subtilis, including MRSA with MIC in the range of 20-50 ug/ml). Antimicrobial activity of this peptide was also demonstrated in vivo using an animal model:mouse infected with S. aureus.  Updated 5/4/2012GW.
Literature Information.Author: Zhao Z, Ma Y, Dai C, Zhao R, Li S, Wu Y, Cao Z, Li W.2009
Literature Information.Title: Imcroporin, a new cationic antimicrobial peptide from the venom of the scorpion Isometrus maculates.
